user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of metal_uio_dev_close:
```c
static void metal_uio_dev_close(struct linux_bus *lbus,
				struct linux_device *ldev)
{
	(void)lbus;
	unsigned int i;

	for (i = 0; i < ldev->device.num_regions; i++) {
		metal_unmap(ldev->device.regions[i].virt,
			    ldev->device.regions[i].size);
	}
	if (ldev->override) {
		sysfs_write_attribute(ldev->override, "", 1);
		ldev->override = NULL;
	}
	if (ldev->sdev) {
		sysfs_close_device(ldev->sdev);
		ldev->sdev = NULL;
	}
	if (ldev->fd >= 0) {
		close(ldev->fd);
	}
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No code in the provided function is demonstrably unreachable from the local view of this translation unit. There are no returns, no code following a return, no conditional compilation disabling code, no infinite loops, and no constant conditional expressions that would make a block impossible to reach at compile time. The for-loop body is executed when ldev->device.num_regions > 0; each if-block is conditional on runtime values (ldev->override, ldev->sdev, ldev->fd) and therefore potentially reachable. The (void)lbus; statement intentionally marks the parameter as used and is itself reachable. The only possible reachability concern that cannot be determined from this snippet alone is whether the static function metal_uio_dev_close is ever called in the project (a static, unreferenced function would be unreachable at program level); that requires whole-project/call-graph analysis and so is outside the scope of the provided code fragment. Therefore no local code fragments within this function need further investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 based on the given source.
